http_method_override.description: Set true to enable support for the '_method' request parameter to determine the intended HTTP method on POST requests.

allowed_http_method_override.description: Sets the list of HTTP methods that can be overridden. Set to null to allow all methods to be overridden (default). Set to an empty array to disallow overrides entirely. Otherwise, provide the list of uppercased method names that are allowed.

trust_x_sendfile_type_header.description: Set true to enable support for xsendfile in binary file responses.

set_locale_from_accept_language.description: Whether to use the Accept-Language HTTP header to set the Request locale (only when the "_locale" request attribute is not passed).

set_content_language_from_locale.description: Whether to set the Content-Language HTTP header on the Response using the Request locale.

enabled_locales.description: Defines the possible locales for the application. This list is used for generating translations files, but also to restrict which locales are allowed when it is set from Accept-Language header (using "set_locale_from_accept_language").

handle_all_throwables.description: HttpKernel will handle all kinds of \Throwable.

stateless_token_ids.description: Enable headers/cookies-based CSRF validation for the listed token ids.

check_header.description: Whether to check the CSRF token in a header in addition to a cookie when using stateless protection.

cookie_name.description: The name of the cookie to use when using stateless protection.

collect_parameter.description: The name of the parameter to use to enable or disable collection on a per request basis.

collect_serializer_data.description: Enables the serializer data collector and profiler panel.

events_to_dispatch.description: Select which Transition events should be dispatched for this Workflow.

guard.description: An expression to block the transition.
examples: is_fully_authenticated() and is_granted('ROLE_JOURNALIST') and subject.getTitle() == 'My first article'

cache_dir.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/framework-bundle 7.1: Setting the "framework.router.cache_dir.cache_dir" configuration option is deprecated. It will be removed in version 8.0.

default_uri.description: The default URI used to generate URLs in a non-HTTP context.

strict_requirements.description:
set to true to throw an exception when a parameter does not match the requirements
set to false to disable exceptions when a parameter does not match the requirements (and return null instead)
set to null to disable parameter checks against requirements
'true' is the preferred configuration in development mode, while 'false' or 'null' might be preferred in production

handler_id.description: Defaults to using the native session handler, or to the native *file* session handler if "save_path" is not null.

save_path.description: Defaults to "%kernel.cache_dir%/sessions" if the "handler_id" option is not null.

metadata_update_threshold.description: Seconds to wait between 2 session metadata updates.

sid_length.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/framework-bundle 7.2: Setting the "framework.session.sid_length.sid_length" configuration option is deprecated. It will be removed in version 8.0. No alternative is provided as PHP 8.4 has deprecated the related option.

sid_bits_per_character.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/framework-bundle 7.2: Setting the "framework.session.sid_bits_per_character.sid_bits_per_character" configuration option is deprecated. It will be removed in version 8.0. No alternative is provided as PHP 8.4 has deprecated the related option.

strict_mode.description: Throw an exception if an entry is missing from the manifest.json.
Throw an exception if an entry is missing from the manifest.json.

excluded_patterns.description: Array of glob patterns of asset file paths that should not be in the asset mapper.

exclude_dotfiles.description: If true, any files starting with "." will be excluded from the asset mapper.

server.description: If true, a "dev server" will return the assets from the public directory (true in "debug" mode only by default).

public_prefix.description: The public path where the assets will be written to (and served from when "server" is true).

missing_import_mode.description: Behavior if an asset cannot be found when imported from JavaScript or CSS files - e.g. "import './non-existent.js'". "strict" means an exception is thrown, "warn" means a warning is logged, "ignore" means the import is left as-is.

importmap_path.description: The path of the importmap.php file.

importmap_polyfill.description: The importmap name that will be used to load the polyfill. Set to false to disable.

vendor_dir.description: The directory to store JavaScript vendors.

formats.description: Array of formats to enable. "brotli", "zstandard" and "gzip" are supported. Defaults to all formats supported by the system. The entire list must be provided.

extensions.description: Array of extensions to compress. The entire list must be provided, no merging occurs.

precompress.description: Precompress assets with Brotli, Zstandard and gzip.

default_path.description: The default path used to load translations.

locales.description: If not set, all locales listed under framework.enabled_locales are used.

cache.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/framework-bundle 7.3: Setting the "framework.validation.cache.cache" configuration option is deprecated. It will be removed in version 8.0.

enabled.description: When disabled, compromised passwords will be accepted as valid.

endpoint.description: API endpoint for the NotCompromisedPassword Validator.

include_built_in_normalizers.description: Whether to include the built-in normalizers

include_built_in_encoders.description: Whether to include the built-in encoders

prefix_seed.description: Used to namespace cache keys when using several apps with the same shared backend.

adapters.description: One or more adapters to chain for creating the pool, defaults to "cache.app".

examples: "300" for 5 minutes expressed in seconds, "PT5M" for five minutes expressed as ISO 8601 time interval, or "5 minutes" as a date expression

provider.description: Overwrite the setting from the default provider for this adapter.

examples: "messenger.default_bus" to send early expiration events to the default Messenger bus.

log.description: Use the application logger instead of the PHP logger for logging PHP errors.
examples: "true" to use the default configuration: log all errors. "false" to disable. An integer bit field of E_* constants, or an array mapping E_* constants to log levels.

log_level.description: The level of log message. Null to let Symfony decide.

status_code.description: The status code of the response. Null or 0 to let Symfony decide.

log_channel.description: The channel of log message. Null to let Symfony decide.

default_serializer.description: Service id to use as the default serializer for the transports.

format.description: Serialization format for the messenger.transport.symfony_serializer service (which is not the serializer used by default).

serializer.description: Service id of a custom serializer to use.

failure_transport.description: Transport name to send failed messages to (after all retries have failed).

service.description: Service id to override the retry strategy entirely.

delay.description: Time in ms to delay (or the initial value when multiplier is used).

multiplier.description: If greater than 1, delay will grow exponentially for each retry: this delay = (delay * (multiple ^ retries)).

max_delay.description: Max time in ms that a retry should ever be delayed (0 = infinite).

jitter.description: Randomness to apply to the delay (between 0 and 1).

rate_limiter.description: Rate limiter name to use when processing messages.

failure_transport.description: Transport name to send failed messages to (after all retries have failed).

stop_worker_on_signals.description: A list of signals that should stop the worker; defaults to SIGTERM and SIGINT.

disallow_search_engine_index.description: Enabled by default when debug is enabled.

max_host_connections.description: The maximum number of connections to a single host.

vars.description: Associative array: the default vars used to expand the templated URI.

max_redirects.description: The maximum number of redirects to follow.

http_version.description: The default HTTP version, typically 1.1 or 2.0, leave to null for the best version.

proxy.description: The URL of the proxy to pass requests through or null for automatic detection.

no_proxy.description: A comma separated list of hosts that do not require a proxy to be reached.

timeout.description: The idle timeout, defaults to the "default_socket_timeout" ini parameter.

max_duration.description: The maximum execution time for the request+response as a whole.

bindto.description: A network interface name, IP address, a host name or a UNIX socket to bind to.

verify_peer.description: Indicates if the peer should be verified in a TLS context.

verify_host.description: Indicates if the host should exist as a certificate common name.

capath.description: A directory that contains multiple certificate authority files.

passphrase.description: The passphrase used to encrypt the "local_pk" file.

ciphers.description: A list of TLS ciphers separated by colons, commas or spaces (e.g. "RC3-SHA:TLS13-AES-128-GCM-SHA256"...)

crypto_method.description: The minimum version of TLS to accept; must be one of STREAM_CRYPTO_METHOD_TLSv*_CLIENT constants.

extra.description: Extra options for specific HTTP client.

rate_limiter.description: Rate limiter name to use for throttling requests.

cache_pool.description: The taggable cache pool to use for storing the responses.

shared.description: Indicates whether the cache is shared (public) or private.

max_ttl.description: The maximum TTL (in seconds) allowed for cached responses. Null means no cap.

retry_strategy.description: service id to override the retry strategy.

methods.description: A list of HTTP methods that triggers a retry for this status code. When empty, all methods are retried.

delay.description: Time in ms to delay (or the initial value when multiplier is used).

multiplier.description: If greater than 1, delay will grow exponentially for each retry: delay * (multiple ^ retries).

max_delay.description: Max time in ms that a retry should ever be delayed (0 = infinite).

jitter.description: Randomness in percent (between 0 and 1) to apply to the delay.

mock_response_factory.description: The id of the service that should generate mock responses. It should be either an invokable or an iterable.

scope.description: The regular expression that the request URL must match before adding the other options. When none is provided, the base URI is used instead.

base_uri.description: The URI to resolve relative URLs, following rules in RFC 3985, section 2.

auth_bearer.description: A token enabling HTTP Bearer authorization.

auth_ntlm.description: A "username:password" pair to use Microsoft NTLM authentication (requires the cURL extension).

max_redirects.description: The maximum number of redirects to follow.

http_version.description: The default HTTP version, typically 1.1 or 2.0, leave to null for the best version.

proxy.description: The URL of the proxy to pass requests through or null for automatic detection.

no_proxy.description: A comma separated list of hosts that do not require a proxy to be reached.

timeout.description: The idle timeout, defaults to the "default_socket_timeout" ini parameter.

max_duration.description: The maximum execution time for the request+response as a whole.

bindto.description: A network interface name, IP address, a host name or a UNIX socket to bind to.

verify_peer.description: Indicates if the peer should be verified in a TLS context.

verify_host.description: Indicates if the host should exist as a certificate common name.

capath.description: A directory that contains multiple certificate authority files.

passphrase.description: The passphrase used to encrypt the "local_pk" file.

ciphers.description: A list of TLS ciphers separated by colons, commas or spaces (e.g. "RC3-SHA:TLS13-AES-128-GCM-SHA256"...).

crypto_method.description: The minimum version of TLS to accept; must be one of STREAM_CRYPTO_METHOD_TLSv*_CLIENT constants.

extra.description: Extra options for specific HTTP client.

rate_limiter.description: Rate limiter name to use for throttling requests.

cache_pool.description: The taggable cache pool to use for storing the responses.

shared.description: Indicates whether the cache is shared (public) or private.

max_ttl.description: The maximum TTL (in seconds) allowed for cached responses. Null means no cap.

retry_strategy.description: service id to override the retry strategy.

methods.description: A list of HTTP methods that triggers a retry for this status code. When empty, all methods are retried.

delay.description: Time in ms to delay (or the initial value when multiplier is used).

multiplier.description: If greater than 1, delay will grow exponentially for each retry: delay * (multiple ^ retries).

max_delay.description: Max time in ms that a retry should ever be delayed (0 = infinite).

jitter.description: Randomness in percent (between 0 and 1) to apply to the delay.

message_bus.description: The message bus to use. Defaults to the default bus if the Messenger component is installed.

allowed_recipients.description: A list of regular expressions that allow recipients when "recipients" option is defined.

key.description: Key content, or path to key (in PEM format with the `file://` prefix)

certificate.description: Path to certificate (in PEM format without the `file://` prefix)

repository.description: S/MIME certificate repository service. This service shall implement the `Symfony\Component\Mailer\EventListener\SmimeCertificateRepositoryInterface`.

cipher.description: A set of algorithms used to encrypt the message

message_bus.description: The message bus to use. Defaults to the default bus if the Messenger component is installed.

lock_factory.description: The service ID of the lock factory used by this limiter (or null to disable locking).

cache_pool.description: The cache pool to use for storing the current limiter state.

storage_service.description: The service ID of a custom storage implementation, this precedes any configured "cache_pool".

policy.description: The algorithm to be used by this limiter.

limiters.description: The limiter names to use when using the "compound" policy.

limit.description: The maximum allowed hits in a fixed interval or burst.

interval.description: Configures the fixed interval if "policy" is set to "fixed_window" or "sliding_window". The value must be a number followed by "second", "minute", "hour", "day", "week" or "month" (or their plural equivalent).
Configures the rate interval. The value must be a number followed by "second", "minute", "hour", "day", "week" or "month" (or their plural equivalent).

amount.description: Amount of tokens to add each interval.

rate.description: Configures the fill rate if "policy" is set to "token_bucket".

allow_static_elements.description: Allows all static elements and attributes from the W3C Sanitizer API standard.

block_elements.description: Configures elements as blocked. Blocked elements are elements the sanitizer should remove from the input, but retain their children.

drop_elements.description: Configures elements as dropped. Dropped elements are elements the sanitizer should remove from the input, including their children.

force_https_urls.description: Transforms URLs using the HTTP scheme to use the HTTPS scheme instead.

allowed_link_schemes.description: Allows only a given list of schemes to be used in links href attributes.

allowed_link_hosts.description: Allows only a given list of hosts to be used in links href attributes.

allow_relative_links.description: Allows relative URLs to be used in links href attributes.

allowed_media_schemes.description: Allows only a given list of schemes to be used in media source attributes (img, audio, video, ...).

allowed_media_hosts.description: Allows only a given list of hosts to be used in media source attributes (img, audio, video, ...).

allow_relative_medias.description: Allows relative URLs to be used in media source attributes (img, audio, video, ...).

max_input_length.description: The maximum length allowed for the sanitized input.

hide_user_not_found.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/security-bundle 7.3: The "hide_user_not_found" option is deprecated and will be removed in 8.0. Use the "expose_security_errors" option instead.

hash_algorithm.description: Name of hashing algorithm for PBKDF2 (i.e. sha256, sha512, etc..) See hash_algos() for a list of supported algorithms.

user_checker.description: The UserChecker to use when authenticating users in this firewall.

entry_point.description: An enabled authenticator name or a service id that implements "Symfony\Component\Security\Http\EntryPoint\AuthenticationEntryPointInterface".

required_badges.description: A list of badges that must be present on the authenticated passport.

commented.deprecationMessage: Since doctrine/doctrine-bundle 2.0: The doctrine-bundle type commenting features were removed; the corresponding config parameter was deprecated in 2.0 and will be dropped in 3.0.

url.description: A URL with connection information; any parameter value parsed from this string will override explicitly set parameters

override_url.deprecationMessage: Since doctrine/doctrine-bundle 2.4: The "doctrine.dbal.override_url" configuration key is deprecated.

dbname_suffix.description: Adds the given suffix to the configured database name, this option has no effects for the SQLite platform

unix_socket.description: The unix socket to use for MySQL

persistent.description: True to use as persistent connection for the ibm_db2 driver

protocol.description: The protocol to use for the ibm_db2 driver (default to TCPIP if omitted)

service.description: True to use SERVICE_NAME as connection parameter instead of SID for Oracle

servicename.description: Overrules dbname parameter if given and used as SERVICE_NAME or SID connection parameter for Oracle depending on the service parameter.

sessionMode.description: The session mode to use for the oci8 driver

server.description: The name of a running database server to connect to for SQL Anywhere.

default_dbname.description: Override the default database (postgres) to connect to for PostgreSQL connexion.

sslmode.description: Determines whether or with what priority a SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server for PostgreSQL.

sslrootcert.description: The name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s). If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.

sslcert.description: The path to the SSL client certificate file for PostgreSQL.

sslkey.description: The path to the SSL client key file for PostgreSQL.

sslcrl.description: The file name of the SSL certificate revocation list for PostgreSQL.

pooled.description: True to use a pooled server with the oci8/pdo_oracle driver

MultipleActiveResultSets.description: Configuring MultipleActiveResultSets for the pdo_sqlsrv driver

instancename.description: Optional parameter, complete whether to add the INSTANCE_NAME parameter in the connection. It is generally used to connect to an Oracle RAC server to select the name of a particular instance.

connectstring.description: Complete Easy Connect connection descriptor, see https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NETAG/naming.htm.When using this option, you will still need to provide the user and password parameters, but the other parameters will no longer be used. Note that when using this parameter, the getHost and getPort methods from Doctrine\DBAL\Connection will no longer function as expected.

platform_service.deprecationMessage: Since doctrine/doctrine-bundle 2.9: The "platform_service" configuration key is deprecated since doctrine-bundle 2.9. DBAL 4 will not support setting a custom platform via connection params anymore.

profiling_collect_backtrace.description: Enables collecting backtraces when profiling is enabled

profiling_collect_schema_errors.description: Enables collecting schema errors when profiling is enabled

keep_slave.deprecationMessage: Since doctrine/doctrine-bundle 2.2: The "keep_slave" configuration key is deprecated since doctrine-bundle 2.2. Use the "keep_replica" configuration key instead.

url.description: A URL with connection information; any parameter value parsed from this string will override explicitly set parameters

override_url.deprecationMessage: Since doctrine/doctrine-bundle 2.4: The "doctrine.dbal.override_url" configuration key is deprecated.

sslkey.description: The path to the SSL client key file for PostgreSQL.

sslcrl.description: The file name of the SSL certificate revocation list for PostgreSQL.

instancename.description: Optional parameter, complete whether to add the INSTANCE_NAME parameter in the connection. It is generally used to connect to an Oracle RAC server to select the name of a particular instance.

connectstring.description: Complete Easy Connect connection descriptor, see https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NETAG/naming.htm.When using this option, you will still need to provide the user and password parameters, but the other parameters will no longer be used. Note that when using this parameter, the getHost and getPort methods from Doctrine\DBAL\Connection will no longer function as expected.

auto_generate_proxy_classes.description: Auto generate mode possible values are: "NEVER", "ALWAYS", "FILE_NOT_EXISTS", "EVAL", "FILE_NOT_EXISTS_OR_CHANGED", this option is ignored when the "enable_native_lazy_objects" option is true

enable_lazy_ghost_objects.description: Enables the new implementation of proxies based on lazy ghosts instead of using the legacy implementation

enable_native_lazy_objects.description: Enables the new native implementation of PHP lazy objects instead of generated proxies

proxy_dir.description: Configures the path where generated proxy classes are saved when using non-native lazy objects, this option is ignored when the "enable_native_lazy_objects" option is true

proxy_namespace.description: Defines the root namespace for generated proxy classes when using non-native lazy objects, this option is ignored when the "enable_native_lazy_objects" option is true

auto_mapping.description: Set to false to disable using route placeholders as lookup criteria when the primary key doesn't match the argument name

evict_cache.description: Set to true to fetch the entity from the database instead of using the cache, if any

report_fields_where_declared.description: Set to "true" to opt-in to the new mapping driver mode that was added in Doctrine ORM 2.16 and will be mandatory in ORM 3.0. See https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/10455.

validate_xml_mapping.description: Set to "true" to opt-in to the new mapping driver mode that was added in Doctrine ORM 2.14 and will be mandatory in ORM 3.0. See https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/6728.

console_formater_options.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/monolog-bundle 3.7: "monolog.handlers..console_formater_options.console_formater_options" is deprecated, use "monolog.handlers..console_formater_options.console_formatter_options" instead.

base_template_class.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/twig-bundle 7.1: The child node "base_template_class" at path "twig.base_template_class" is deprecated.

default_path.description: The default path used to load templates.

file_name_pattern.description: Pattern of file name used for cache warmer and linter.

timezone.description: The timezone used when formatting dates, when set to null, the timezone returned by date_default_timezone_get() is used.

date.description: The default format options used by the date filter.

number_format.description: The default format options for the number_format filter.

max_items.description: Max number of displayed items past the first level, -1 means no limit.

min_depth.description: Minimum tree depth to clone all the items, 1 is default.

max_string_length.description: Max length of displayed strings, -1 means no limit.

dump_destination.description: A stream URL where dumps should be written to.
examples: php://stderr, or tcp://%env(VAR_DUMPER_SERVER)% when using the "server:dump" command

theme.description: Changes the color of the dump() output when rendered directly on the templating. "dark" (default) or "light".

table_storage.description: The default metadata storage, implemented as a table in the database.

storage.description: Storage to use for migration status metadata.

migrations.description: A list of migrations to load in addition to the one discovered via "migrations_paths".

connection.description: Connection name to use for the migrations database.

em.description: Entity manager name to use for the migrations database (available when doctrine/orm is installed).

all_or_nothing.description: Run all migrations in a transaction.

check_database_platform.description: Adds an extra check in the generated migrations to allow execution only on the same platform as they were initially generated on.

custom_template.description: Custom template path for generated migration classes.

organize_migrations.description: Organize migrations mode. Possible values are: "BY_YEAR", "BY_YEAR_AND_MONTH", false

enable_profiler.description: Whether or not to enable the profiler collector to calculate and visualize migration status. This adds some queries overhead.

transactional.description: Whether or not to wrap migrations in a single transaction.

renderer.description: Array of options for rendering HTML.

allow_unsafe_links.description: Remove risky link and image URLs by setting this to false.

max_nesting_level.description: The maximum nesting level for blocks.

slug_normalizer.description: Array of options for configuring how URL-safe slugs are created.

commonmark.description: Array of options for configuring the CommonMark core extension.

profiler.description: Enables the profiler for Twig Component (in debug mode)

controllers_json.deprecationMessage: Since symfony/ux-twig-component 2.18: The "twig_component.controllers_json" config option is deprecated, and will be removed in 3.0.

secret.description: The secret used to compute fingerprints and checksums

root_sass.description: Path to your Sass root file

style.description: The style of the generated CSS: compressed or expanded.

charset.description: Whether to include the charset declaration in the generated Sass.

error_css.description: Emit a CSS file when an error occurs.

embed_sources.description: Embed source file contents in source maps.

embed_source_map.description: Embed source map contents in CSS.

quiet_deps.description: Don't print compiler warnings from dependencies.

stop_on_error.description: Don't compile more files once an error is encountered.

trace.description: Print full Dart stack traces for exceptions.

embed_sourcemap.deprecationMessage: Since symfonycast/sass-bundle 0.4: Option "embed_sourcemap" at "symfonycasts_sass.embed_sourcemap" is deprecated. Use "sass_options.embed_source_map" instead".

icon_dir.description: The local directory where icons are stored.

default_icon_attributes.description: Default attributes to add to all icons.

path.description:
The local icon set directory path.
(cannot be used with 'alias')

alias.description:
The remote icon set identifier.
(cannot be used with 'path')

icon_attributes.description: Override default icon attributes for icons in this set.

aliases.description: Icon aliases (map of alias => full name).

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Iconify icons API.

iconify.description: Configuration for the remote icon service.

ignore_not_found.description:
Ignore error when an icon is not found.
Set to 'true' to fail silently.
